data.title: Obituary for William F. Koch
data.meta_description: Koch, William F. (Bill) 90, of Alpharetta, GA passed away on Friday, February 3, 2017.  Bill was born on February 3, 1927.  Bill is survived by his beloved wife Patricia, his two sons Doug and Philip, his daughter Lenore and her husband, Phil Giansante, 6...
data.text:
Koch, William F. (Bill) 90, of Alpharetta, GA passed away on Friday, February 3, 2017. Bill was born on February 3, 1927. Bill is survived by his beloved wife Patricia, his two sons Doug and Philip, his daughter Lenore and her husband, Phil Giansante, 6 grandchildren: Patrick Koch; Christopher Koch and wife Emily; Rebecca and husband Kurt Zimmermann; Corissa and her husband Gael Appler; Nicholas and his wife Darcie Giansante; and Zachary Giansante and 6 great grandchildren.

Bill was a WWII Veteran in the Army. He retired after a long career at Doubleday Book Company before moving down to Georgia. He was actively involved for many years in Fulton County with local senior citizen groups, his church and in volunteering at North Fulton Hospital.

His beautiful life will be forever cherished in the lives of his family.

A Mass of Christian burial was held at St. Benedict Catholic Church of Johns Creek, GA on February 7, 2017.

Final Arrangements Managed by Medford-Peden Funeral Home & Crematory ~ Marietta, Georgia.

Charitable donations may be made to:

American Cancer Society

P.O. Box 22718, Oklahoma City OK 73123

Tel: 1-800-227-2345

Web: http://www.cancer.org/
